intro: Casearia coronata, commonly known as the Crowned Casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when ripe. Casearia coronata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
